business.headline: Criminal angle in Kalyani family feud as police begin inquiry into property fraudIndustrialist Gaurishankar Kalyani and his wife are to be summoned by police for an inquiry into the illegal transfer of ancestral properties by cheating and duping sister Sugandha Hiremath.

Samvat 2082: Top stocks and sectors to bet on for the new yearIndia's macroeconomic fundamentals remain firm. Global rating agency S&P recently upgraded India's credit outlook, while the International Monetary Fund (IMF) raised its GDP forecast.

Curious case of RRP Semiconductor: The stock that gained 63,000% in 18 monthsRRP Semiconductor's stock soared from Rs 15 to Rs 9,478 in just 18 months, stunning Dalal Street. But do the company's financials really justify this meteoric rise?

Waaree Energies shares jump 50% in a year: More upside left in the stock?The company's Q2 FY26 results were strong across all key metrics. Waaree Energies reported a 132.97% year-on-year jump in consolidated net profit to Rs 871.21 crore in the September 2025 quarter, compared to Rs 375.66 crore a year ago.

Will gold, silver prices fall in India tomorrow as global rates crash?Global gold and silver have cooled after historic gains, while MCX remains closed. Will Indian investors face similar declines tomorrow, or is this a buying opportunity? Read on to find out.

US likely to cut tariffs on Indian imports to 15%-16%: ReportThe proposed agreement mainly focusses on the energy and agriculture sectors. One of the key elements under discussion is India's gradual reduction of crude oil imports from Russia, a move that aligns with Washington's efforts to limit global dependence on Russian energy supplies.

Samvat 2082: 15 high-conviction stock ideas amid ongoing market rallyAnalysts see higher returns ahead as Dalal Street enters Samvat 2082. Check out Choice Broking's top 15 stock picks span defence, tech, and premium consumption.

BSE, NSE holiday: Is stock market open or closed for trading today?The stock market was closed on Tuesday on account of Diwali and only two more holidays remain this year. One for Guru Nanank Jayanti on November 05 and the other for Christmas, December 25.

Gold, silver prices fall: Is the bullion rally ending?Gold prices have gained nearly 56% this year due to strong demand from central banks, ongoing geopolitical tensions, and rising expectations of rate cuts by major central banks.

Muhurat Trading ends in green; Cipla, Bajaj Finserv among top gainersThe BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty50 both closed in the green, led by gains in Cipla and Bajaj Finserv, even as mid-session profit booking trimmed early advances.

Samvat 2082: Experts see new highs, bet on domestic sectorsFor investors, Bandyopadhyay recommends focusing on domestic growth stories. "Cement, infrastructure, construction, and capital goods will lead the charge," he noted, highlighting Ultratech Cement, L&T, and Bharti Airtel as top picks.

Muhurat Trading 2025: Sensex, Nifty dip after strong opening; Infosys up 1%The BSE Sensex rose 180.76 points, or 0.21%, to 84,544.13, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 62.60 points, or 0.24%, to 25,905.75 at 1:50 pm.
How to make the most of your Diwali bonus and build long-term wealthTurn your Diwali bonus into a stepping stone for long-term financial security with these expert-backed tips.

Gold hits Rs 1.30 lakh again, silver at Rs 1.58 lakh: Buy now or wait for a dip?Gold and silver are regaining momentum amid festive demand and global uncertainty. Investors should buy with discipline, stagger purchases, and treat bullion as a long-term hedge rather than chasing short-term spikes.

Muhurat Trading today: Your quick guide to today's one-hour special sessionAs Muhurat Trading 2025 begins this afternoon, optimism runs high on Dalal Street. With Nifty near record highs and liquidity improving, experts suggest discipline, stock selection, and long-term focus.

Sensex, Nifty end higher on Diwali as Reliance, bank stocks shineThe BSE Sensex rose 0.5% to 84,363.37, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 0.49% to 25,851—both hitting fresh one-year highs. Over the past four sessions, the indices have climbed 2.8%, leaving them less than 2% away from their all-time highs scaled in September 2024.

China files WTO complaint against India over EV subsidies and batteriesThe Chinese Commerce Ministry has alleged that the measures by India violate several WTO obligations, including the principle of national treatment, and constitute import substitution subsidies, which are explicitly prohibited under the multi-lateral trade rules.

Muhurat Trading on October 21: Check timing, trade strategy and moreMuhurat Trading will take place on October 21 this year. The pre-open session will run from 1:30 pm to 1:45 pm, followed by the main trading window from 1:45 pm to 2:45 pm, and a closing session until 3:05 pm.

Reliance shares jump 3% after Q2 results. Should it be in your Diwali portfolio?Around 10:20 am, shares of Reliance Industries rose 3.22% to Rs 1,462.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The stock's sharp upmove added to the broader market rally on Dalal Street as sentiment turned upbeat following a string of solid earnings reports.

Diwali cheer on Dalal Street as Sensex jumps nearly 700 pointsAt around 9:23 am, the S&P BSE Sensex jumped 673.90 points to 84,626.09, while the NSE Nifty50 surged 202.50 points to 25,912.35. Broader market indices also witnessed sharp gains, and volatility dropped, indicating strong investor confidence.

entertainment.headline: After Good Bad Ugly, Ilaiyaraaja takes legal action against Pradeep Ranganathan's Dude Composer Ilaiyaraaja has moved the Madras High Court alleging copyright infringement over the use of his songs in Pradeep Ranganathan's Tamil film 'Dude'.

Dude director Keerthiswaran: Old Rajinikanth films showed true sacrifice as heroism Keerthiswaran highlighted selfless acts as true heroism, citing old Rajinikanth films as examples of selfless acts being heroic.

Joju George's first look poster from Jeethu Joseph's Valathu Vashathe Kallan out Jeethu Joseph unveiled Joju George's character poster as Samuel Joseph, highlighting crime, conscience, and the film's gripping tone.

Lucky Ali's 'apology' to Javed Akhtar after salvo: Even monsters have feelings Singer Lucky Ali has seemingly issued a clarification after his earlier comments on veteran lyricist and writer Javed Akhtar over the latter's viral video about Hindu-Muslim dynamics. However, did the singer's words reveal a hint of sarcasm?

Sanya Malhotra shares BTS clip from Charmer, fans call her female Hrithik Sanya Malhotra shared a stunning BTS dance rehearsal in heels for singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh's new song – 'Charmer'. Sanya also expressed gratitude to the team while cherishing the experience of working on the dance track.

Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat: OTT release date, platform and streaming details 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' will reportedly be available on OTT around 45 to 60 days after its theatrical release. The film, starring Harshvardhan Rane and Sonam Bajwa, opened well at the box office despite tough competition from 'Thamma'.

They Call Him OG OTT release: When and where to watch Pawan Kalyan's crime drama Pawan Kalyan's blockbuster 'They Call Him OG', the highest-grossing Telugu film of 2025, is set to premiere on Netflix on October 23. Directed by Sujeeth, the action-packed crime drama also stars Emraan Hashmi, Priyanka Mohan, and Prakash Raj.

Ayushmann Khurrana offers prayers at Siddhivinayak after Thamma's Diwali success Ayushmann Khurrana visited Mumbai's Siddhivinayak Temple to seek blessings after his film 'Thamma' emerged as a major hit in the Maddock horror-comedy universe. The film's unique love story and strong cast have struck a chord with audiences, marking a big win for both the actor and the franchise.

Thamma ending explained: How Betaal vs Betaal fight sets the stage for greater war Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Thamma' ends with a fierce Betaal vs Betaal showdown, something the trailer had also teased. But the final twist hints at a much larger conflict brewing within Maddock's horror-comedy universe.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12: Wildcard entrants stir chaos among contestants The twelfth season of Bigg Boss Kannada introduced a major twist at the end of three weeks with three wild card contestants, Mutant Raghu, Risha Gowda and Suraj Singh, entering the house.

Pooja Ruparel on 30 years of DDLJ: Kajol was like elder sister, SRK true prince Actor Pooja Ruparel spoke to India Today about her experience on the sets of 'Dilwale Dulhaniya Le Jayenge'. Starring Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol, the film completed 30 years of release on October 20.

Bestest mommy in town: Raghav Chadha wishes Parineeti with baby bump pics Politician Raghav Chadha extended birthday greetings to his actor-wife Parineeti Chopra with an adorable post on Instagram. The couple recently welcomed a baby boy.

Jr NTR and I trusted YRF, but it misfired: Telugu distributor Naga Vamsi on War 2 Telugu producer Naga Vamsi, who distributed the Telugu version of 'War 2', reflected on the film's underperformance and his trust in YRF. 'War 2', starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, faced box office disappointment despite a strong opening.

Kajol's Diwali post celebrates life's cycle, family and new beginnings Actor Kajol shared a Diwali post about the cycle of life and new beginnings. She celebrated the festival with her family, including Ajay Devgn and their children.

Rishab Shetty plans crisper English version for Kantara Chapter 1 globally Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara Chapter 1' gears up for a global English release on October 31 with a crisper cut tailored for international audiences.
Lucky Ali slams Javed Akhtar for 'don't become like Muslims' remark Singer Lucky Ali has responded to Javed Akhtar after a video surfaced of Akhtar telling Hindus not to become like Muslims

AI pics of Squid Game actor Lee Jung Jae used to scam woman of 500 million KRW Woman in her 50s loses approximately 350,000 USD in an online impersonation scam involving fake AI-generated photos and social media communications claiming to be from Squid Game star Lee Jung Jae.

Ayushmann Khurrana: Thamma breaks myth that only superstar films work on Diwali Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Thamma' scored the biggest opening of his career with Rs 25.11 crore on Diwali. The actor called it a dream-come-true moment and said the film proves audiences still value original stories.

Krishna Shroff on losing Chhoriyan Chali Gaon to Anita: It was a personal win After emerging as the runner-up of 'Chhoriyan Chali Gaon', Krishna Shroff opened up about her equation with actor Anita Hassanandani. In an exclusive conversation, Krishna also shared how the show's host, Rannvijay Singha, influenced her journey.

general news.headline: First pics of cell readied for Mehul Choksi inside Mumbai's Arthur Road JailIndia has submitted photos of Mumbai's Arthur Road Jail's Barrack No 12, where fugitive jeweller Mehul Choksi will be kept after extradition, to Belgian authorities to counter his claims about poor prison conditions.

Will gold, silver prices fall in India tomorrow as global rates crash?Global gold and silver have cooled after historic gains, while MCX remains closed. Will Indian investors face similar declines tomorrow, or is this a buying opportunity? Read on to find out.

Why protest over China-backed Teesta plan in Bangladesh is a red flag for DelhiThousands in Bangladesh's Chattogram held a massive rally demanding the implementation of the China-backed Teesta River Master Plan. However, experts say the plan involving Beijing, amid stalled water-sharing talks with India, could pose strategic risks for New Delhi due to its proximity to the sensitive Siliguri Corridor.

BCCI to escalate Asia Cup trophy row to ICC, rejects Mohsin Naqvi's suggestionThe BCCI is keen on escalating the Asia Cup trophy handover dispute with the International Cricket Council after ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi, also PCB chairman, insisted the trophy be collected directly from him rather than sent across borders.

Rotten eggs? Inside India's farm-to-table health scarePoultry farm egg quality in India is deteriorating, and it is linked to expensive feed, heat stress, and fake eggs entering markets. This decline is now threatening nutrition, raising health concerns across the country.

Siddaramaiah in last stage of politics: Son namedrops next potential successor?Yatindra, Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's son and Congress MLC, said his father is in the final stage of his political career. He named Satish Jarkiholi as a leader he can guide and an ideal model.

Because Sarfaraz is Khan? Congress's Shama Mohamed jabs Gambhir in selection rowCongress spokesperson Shama Mohamed questioned India coach Gautam Gambhir over the non-selection of Sarfaraz Khan in the recent national team assignments despite his good form in domestic cricket.

What's kafala that turns millions of Indians into slaves in the Gulf?The kafala system in Gulf countries enables employers to seize passports, control movement, institutionalise abuse and turn millions of migrant workers, with the largest chunk from India, into "modern-day slaves". Saudi Arabia has finally scrapped the 50-year-old setup, but several Gulf Cooperation Council countries still facilitate abuse under the kafala system.

Woman slams Taj Delhi restaurant for asking her to not sit cross-legged, posts videoIn a now-viral video, Shradha Sharma claimed that a hotel manager approached her during the meal and told her not to sit cross-legged as it was making other guests uncomfortable.

Medical college seats are at a record high. So why is competition still so hard?Despite a record expansion in medical seats in 2025 which lifted the total above 1.3 lakhs, NEET applicants still outnumber MBBS seats by roughly 20:1. Government medical seats are prized and private fees are steep, making medical competition absolutely brutal — unlike engineering, where far more seats and multiple exams make admissions comparatively easier.

US likely to cut tariffs on Indian imports to 15%-16%: ReportThe proposed agreement mainly focusses on the energy and agriculture sectors. One of the key elements under discussion is India's gradual reduction of crude oil imports from Russia, a move that aligns with Washington's efforts to limit global dependence on Russian energy supplies.

Pakistan has egg on face as Imperial College London busts Lahore campus claimsThe Punjab government of Pakistan announced a new campus of London's Imperial College campus in Lahore. However, the UK university quickly denied the claim, saying it had "no such plans". The fake claim by the Maryam Nawaz-led provincial government, which she herself amplified, sparked criticism from an alumnus of the Imperial College, who slammed the government.
Lucky Ali slams Javed Akhtar for 'don't become like Muslims' remarkSinger Lucky Ali has responded to Javed Akhtar after a video surfaced of Akhtar telling Hindus not to become like Muslims

Elon Musk says AI will take every job and humans will be free to grow vegetablesTech billionaire Elon Musk has claimed that Artificial Intelligence (AI) and robots will take over all jobs in the future. However, he insists that humans won't actually need to work and can grow vegetables if they wish to.

UP man turns judge with Bluffmaster, Special 26 lessons, targets divorceesUP man Vishnu Shankar Gupta, inspired by Bollywood con films like Special 26 and Bluffmaster, impersonated a judge, an IAS officer, and an IPS cop to exploit divorced and widowed women, cheating them out of lakhs of rupees. He carried out the elaborate scam with the help of his ex-wife Ayushi Gupta.

PM Modi's Diwali call with Trump carries strong message on Pakistan, terrorModi-Trump call: In their second phone call in as many months, PM Modi used the occasion to underscore India's firm stance against terrorism, subtly flagging New Delhi's discomfort with Washington's growing proximity to Pakistan.

Bengaluru airport staff trace Chandigarh man's lost bag using UPI transactionIn a post on X, Jaskaran Singh said that he accidentally left his bag on a Kia shuttle bus on the way to Kempegowda International Airport.

Trump has a new playlist, 'I ended India-Pakistan war' now passeModi-Trump call: Over the past week, Trump repeated four times that PM Modi assured him of halting Russian oil purchases. Surprisingly, Trump's boast about stopping the India-Pakistan conflict, which he has repeated over 50 times, has been MIA.

Proud Kannadiga: Kiran Shaw to trolls questioning loyalty amid Bengaluru civic rowDays after raising concerns about Bengaluru's poor roads and garbage, Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw faced criticism questioning her Kannadiga roots. She firmly defended her lifelong connection to Karnataka, drawing public support.

Why Bengaluru's problem lies in misplaced pride and prioritiesThat Biocon founder, Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, had to profess her love for Kannada after slamming Bengaluru's civic mess shows what truly ails Karnataka. With Kannada pride becoming the fulcrum of populist politics, Karnataka's politicians have made Bengaluru's potholes their very own but cast away the corporates who helped them build the state and the city.
Too nervous to pee? The anxiety women can't flush awayWho knew peeing could be so stressful? From office meetings to café visits, women are stuck holding it in.

Delhi hogs the attention after Diwali, but air in these cities is just as toxicDelhi pollution: Delhi recorded its worst post-Diwali air quality in the last four years on Tuesday, sparking concerns and debates among climate activists. However, the same sense of urgency or focus goes missing when it comes to other metro cities.

Ex-Punjab DGP son's medical history, syringe mark: What police are probingAqil, an advocate, was found dead at his residence in Haryana on October 16. His family claimed that he died due to a drug overdose. However, two old videos of Aqil alleging mental harassment by his family have brought a twist to the case.

Curious case of RRP Semiconductor: The stock that gained 63,000% in 18 monthsRRP Semiconductor's stock soared from Rs 15 to Rs 9,478 in just 18 months, stunning Dalal Street. But do the company's financials really justify this meteoric rise?

sports.headline: Defiant India coach Amol Muzumdar brushes aside Pratika's strike-rate criticism India coach Amol Muzumdar has brushed aside the criticism around Pratika Rawal's strike-rate ahead of the clash against New Zealand. The Indian opener has been sedate with her approach, especially in the powerplay overs.

BCCI invites quotations for Women's Premier League official partner rights The BCCI has launched a tender process for securing 'Official Partner Rights' for the Women's Premier League, with RFQs available until November 12 and final proposals due by November 21.

Watch: Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli lead Team India's Diwali team dinner in Adelaide India tour of Australia: Indian cricket stars Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, and Shubman Gill were spotted dining at a popular Indian restaurant in Adelaide. The team's get-together coincided with the Diwali festivities, as the players enjoyed a relaxed evening ahead of the second ODI against Australia.

Lanka Premier League 2025 postponed to help Sri Lanka prepare for T20 World Cup Sri Lanka Cricket has postponed the 2025 Lanka Premier League to focus on preparations for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026. The decision comes as part of efforts to ensure world-class venues and facilities for the co-hosted global tournament.

With fewer ODIs ahead, ex-selector wants Rohit, Kohli to play more domestic cricket Former selector Sanjay Jagdale recommends Kohli and Rohit to play domestic cricket to keep their ODI skills sharp. Their fitness and form will be crucial if India aims to have the two for their 2027 World Cup campaign.

Virat Kohli's Adelaide swansong: India vs Australia 2nd ODI tickets sold out There will be a full house to witness Virat Kohli in action at the Adelaide Oval on Thursday, with tickets for the second ODI between India and Australia officially sold out. Cricket Australia confirmed the development on Wednesday.

Misbah ul Haq to lead PCB international cricket operations Former Pakistan Test captain Misbah-ul-Haq is set to take over as the Pakistan Cricket Board's (PCB) Director of International Cricket Operations. According to the job advertisement, the key requirement for the position is that the candidate must be a former domestic or international cricketer.

Harbhajan Singh, Piyush Chawla headline big names list for Abu Dhabi T10 2025 Harbhajan Singh, Piyush Chawla and S. Sreesanth are among the big names who have signed up for the 2025 edition of the Abu Dhabi T10 League. The new season will two debutant teams battle it out for the title.

BCCI to escalate Asia Cup trophy row to ICC, rejects Mohsin Naqvi's suggestion The BCCI is keen on escalating the Asia Cup trophy handover dispute with the International Cricket Council after ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi, also PCB chairman, insisted the trophy be collected directly from him rather than sent across borders.

Kagiso Rabada hits 71, scripts South African record in Rawalpindi Test PAK vs SA, 2nd Test: Kagiso Rabada scored his maiden Test fifty with a record 71 runs as South Africa took a first innings lead of 71 runs. The South African No. 11 tore into Pakistan's bowling attack on Day 3 in Rawalpindi.

WPL 2026 auction set to take place in New Delhi on November 26-27 window: Reports The Women's Premier League (WPL) auction is set for New Delhi on November 26-27, with franchises allowed to retain up to five players under revised rules, including the RTM option.

Misbah ul Haq to lead PCB international cricket operations Former Pakistan Test captain Misbah-ul-Haq is set to take over as the Pakistan Cricket Board's (PCB) Director of International Cricket Operations. According to the job advertisement, the key requirement for the position is that the candidate must be a former domestic or international cricketer.

Harbhajan Singh, Piyush Chawla headline big names list for Abu Dhabi T10 2025 Harbhajan Singh, Piyush Chawla and S. Sreesanth are among the big names who have signed up for the 2025 edition of the Abu Dhabi T10 League. The new season will two debutant teams battle it out for the title.

BCCI to escalate Asia Cup trophy row to ICC, rejects Mohsin Naqvi's suggestion The BCCI is keen on escalating the Asia Cup trophy handover dispute with the International Cricket Council after ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi, also PCB chairman, insisted the trophy be collected directly from him rather than sent across borders.

Kagiso Rabada hits 71, scripts South African record in Rawalpindi Test PAK vs SA, 2nd Test: Kagiso Rabada scored his maiden Test fifty with a record 71 runs as South Africa took a first innings lead of 71 runs. The South African No. 11 tore into Pakistan's bowling attack on Day 3 in Rawalpindi.

WPL 2026 auction set to take place in New Delhi on November 26-27 window: Reports The Women's Premier League (WPL) auction is set for New Delhi on November 26-27, with franchises allowed to retain up to five players under revised rules, including the RTM option.

Asia Cup Trophy Standoff: ACC To Return India's Asia Cup Trophy After Pak's Naqvi 'Ran Away' With ItA major controversy has erupted between the BCCI and the Asian Cricket Council (ACC) over the Asia Cup 2025 trophy, involving ACC President Mohsin Naqvi. The BCCI has demanded an explanation stating, 'how and why the awards were withheld at the venue, and on what authority the ACC President took possession of them'. After the Indian team, led by Suryakumar Yadav, refused to accept the trophy from Naqvi following their victory over Pakistan, the ACC chief reportedly took the silverware. The ACC has now proposed a formal handover ceremony in Dubai on November 10, an invitation India is unlikely to accept. The BCCI has warned that the matter will be escalated to the ICC next month if the trophy is not returned.

Gyokeres makes Arsenal a better team: Arteta praises striker after Atleti winMikel Arteta heaped praise on Viktor Gyokeres for breaking his goal drought for Arsenal after their win over Atletico Madrid. Gyokeres scored a brace as the Gunners thumped Atleti 4-0 on Tuesday, October 21.

2nd ODI Preview: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma face litmus test in AdelaideIndia vs Australia: India have travelled to Adelaide to play their second ODI of the series. Will Virat Kohli step up in his favourite hunting ground with series on the line?

Cong Neta Links Sarfaraz Khan's Snub To Religion; Slams Coach GambhirA massive controversy has erupted over the non-selection of cricketer Sarfaraz Khan, with Congress leader Shama Mohammed alleging religious bias. In her statement, Mohammed questioned if Sarfaraz was sidelined due to his surname, stating, 'Sarfaraz was left out due to his surname?'. The debate intensified as she also pointed fingers at India's head coach, Gautam Gambhir. The programme explores the political firestorm, featuring arguments from AIMIM's Waris Pathan, who highlighted Khan's exceptional domestic record and fitness improvements. Countering the allegations, former UP Minister Mohsin Raza condemned the politicization of cricket, reminding critics of India's history of Muslim captains and players. The discussion delves into whether Khan's exclusion is a matter of cricketing logic, as suggested by some, or a case of discrimination as alleged by opposition figures.

Mohsin Naqvi orders review after Pakistan flops in Women's World Cup: ReportPCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi has ordered a review of the Pakistan team's performance in the Women's World Cup 2025. Pakistan remains winless in the tournament and were knocked out of the running for the semi-finals after their loss to South Africa on October 21.

Lt Col Neeraj Chopra officially pipped, receives rank in special ceremonyOlympic champion Neeraj Chopra was officially presented with the honorary rank of Lieutenant Colonel in the Territorial Army. The ceremony in New Delhi, attended by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, recognised his achievements in athletics.

Mohsin Naqvi orders review after Pakistan flops in Women's World Cup: ReportPCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi has ordered a review of the Pakistan team's performance in the Women's World Cup 2025. Pakistan remains winless in the tournament and were knocked out of the running for the semi-finals after their loss to South Africa on October 21.

Lt Col Neeraj Chopra officially pipped, receives rank in special ceremonyOlympic champion Neeraj Chopra was officially presented with the honorary rank of Lieutenant Colonel in the Territorial Army. The ceremony in New Delhi, attended by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, recognised his achievements in athletics.

AUS vs IND: Virat Kohli chases history as India look to retaliate in Adelaide ODIAUS vs IND, 2nd ODI: Virat Kohli is 25 runs away from becoming the first visiting batter to score 1000 runs at the Adelaide Oval when India and Australia lock horns at the venue on Thursday.

FC Goa vs Al Nassr FC: When and where to watch AFC Champions League 2 clashAl Nassr will be aiming to keep their winning momentum going in the AFC Champions League 2 as they take on FC Goa in Fatorda. The Indian side has lost their first two games in the tournament.

Because Sarfaraz is Khan? Congress's Shama Mohamed jabs Gambhir in selection rowCongress spokesperson Shama Mohamed questioned India coach Gautam Gambhir over the non-selection of Sarfaraz Khan in the recent national team assignments despite his good form in domestic cricket.

The bulldog in Shubman Gill comes out when team needs him most: Ricky PontingRicky Ponting said that he has been impressed by Shubman Gill's captaincy so far ahead of the second ODI between Australia and India. Gill was made captain earlier in the year and is tipped to be the skipper for India in all three formats soon.

Pakistan's Asif Afridi, 38, becomes oldest to take 5-wicket haul on Test debutPakistan vs South Africa: 38-year-old Asif Afridi became the oldest bowler to take a five-wicket haul on Test debut. The left-arm spinner ran through South Africa's middle-order on Days 2 and 3 of the Rawalpindi Test.

Hattrick hero Fermin hails perfect El Clasico prep after Barca rout OlympiacosFC Barcelona routed Olympiacos in the Champions League. Fermin Lopez hit his maiden hattrick for the club as they capped off a perfect game ahead of El Clasico on Sunday, October 26.

Virat Kohli inspires even in failure: How Perth duck calmed Aussie debutant's nerveIndia tour of Australia: Virat Kohli's rare failure in Perth turned into a source of calm for Australian debutant Matt Renshaw. As nerves crept in before his first ODI innings, seeing the Indian maestro fall for a duck reminded Renshaw that even the greats have off days – and that failure is part of the game.

Virat-Rohit get thumbs up from Sitanshu Kotak ahead of Adelaide ODIIndia vs Australia: India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak has given the vote of confidence to Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma ahead of the 2nd ODI clash of the series. Kotak said that both batted well in the nets.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
